go_data.justification: B7-H1/PD-L1 costimulates T cell proliferation and cytokine release at lower concentrations of anti-CD3.
Expression of B7-H1/PD-L1 is broadly distributed on multiple hematopoietic and nonhematopoietic tissues, raising interesting questions as to their relative role in immune response regulation.
B7-H1/PD-L1 is a member of the B7 family and binds to the PD-1 receptor, implying it is located on the cell surface.
